word_mean: 檀木，檀香：白檀或黄檀及檀木属的其他种芳香树木。另见oil项下santal oil
紫檀：为豆科树紫檀的干燥心材，可用作着色剂

sentence.Network_en: Sandalwood. It's a kind of precious wood in China.
sentence.Network_cn: 檀香木. 那是中国的一种珍贵木材.

sentence.Network_en: This product becomes by the red sandalwood lump fine vulture.
sentence.Network_cn: 本产品由紫檀瘤精雕而成.

sentence.Network_en: Mysore sandalwood oil was renowned and considered superior to all other varieties.
sentence.Network_cn: 迈索尔檀香油是著名的,并认为优于其他所有品种.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: sandal from medieval Latin sandalum (based on Sanskrit candana) + wood

entry.def: Sandalwood is the sweet-smelling wood of a tree that is found in South Asia and Australia. It is also the name of the tree itself.
Sandalwood is the oil extracted from the wood of the tree. It is used to make perfume.

means.word_mean: 1. close-grained fragrant yellowish heartwood of the true sandalwood; has insect-repelling properties and is used for carving and cabinetwork

auth_sentence.content: It is bathed with milk, water and honey, and then anointed with sandalwood paste, and decorated with flowers and garlands.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is bathed with milk, water and honey, and then anointed with sandalwood paste, and decorated with flowers and garlands.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is bathed with milk, water and honey, and then anointed with sandalwood paste, and decorated with flowers and garlands.

auth_sentence.content: It smelled as sweet as sandalwood and was said to impart its fragrance to food and drink.
